channel.title: CVE Feed for HackerOne -- hapi node module
channel.description: The latest CVEs for HackerOne -- hapi node module

item.title: CVE-2015-9243|2024-09-17T02:27:19.677Z -- hackerone -- hapi%20node%20module
item.description: When server level, connection level or route level CORS configurations in hapi node module before 11.1.4 are combined and when a higher level config included security restrictions (like origin), a higher level config that included security restrictions (like origin) would have those restrictions overridden by less restrictive defaults (e.g. origin defaults to all origins `*`).

item.title: CVE-2017-16013|2024-09-17T04:09:41.605Z -- hackerone -- hapi%20node%20module
item.description: hapi is a web and services application framework. When hapi >= 15.0.0 <= 16.1.0 encounters a malformed `accept-encoding` header an uncaught exception is thrown. This may cause hapi to crash or to hang the client connection until the timeout period is reached.

item.title: CVE-2015-9236|2024-09-17T04:15:13.448Z -- hackerone -- hapi%20node%20module
item.description: Hapi versions less than 11.0.0 implement CORS incorrectly and allowed for configurations that at best returned inconsistent headers and at worst allowed cross-origin activities that were expected to be forbidden. If the connection has CORS enabled but one route has it off, and the route is not GET, the OPTIONS prefetch request will return the default CORS headers and then the actual request will go through and return no CORS headers. This defeats the purpose of turning CORS on the route.
